subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Again, I think that s already true. Look at the number of extensions there are out there. Just because they re not in JUnit s contrib/ directory doesn t
messageBody:
Sven Gorts wrote:

> --- Bill_de_h√ìra <dehora@...> wrote:
>
>>It's not about that, it's about who has commit
>>access. Junit 3.8,1
>>was release in Sept 2002. As such it looks like a
>>dead/abandoned
>>project to me. No doubt forking to get to Junit 4
>>has crossed some
>>peoples minds.
>
> Indeed, perhaps the authors should open up the
> repository for contributions by the open source
> community.

Again, I think that's already true. Look at the number of extensions
there are out there. Just because they're not in JUnit's contrib/
directory doesn't make them any less contributions to JUnit.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
